citation.article-title: Enterococcus haemoperoxidus sp. nov. and Enterococcus moraviensis sp. nov., isolated from water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Enterococcus moraviensis sp. nov.
Enterococcus moraviensis (mo.ra.vi.en'sis. N. L. adj. moraviensis pertaining to Moravia, the region in the Czech Republic from which the strains originate)
Gram-positive, ovoid cells occurring in pairs, short chains or in small groups, elongated in the direction of chains.
Non-pigmented, non-motile, catalase-negative and group D antigen-positive.
Weak amylase production on Columbia agar.
Other physiological features as well as growth characteristics are as described above.

Acid is produced from glycerol, L-arabinose, ribose, galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, mannitol, methyl α-D-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, β-gentiobiose, D-turanose, D-tagatose and maltotriose.
Most strains produce acid from inositol.

Acid is not produced from erythritol, D-arabinose, D- or L-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, rhamnose, dulcitol, sorbitol, methyl α-D-mannoside, melibiose, inulin, xylitol, D-lyxose, D-or L-fucose, D- or L-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
Most strains do not produce acid from L-sorbose, D-raffinose or glycogen.
Acid production from starch is variable.
Positive for acetoin, hippurate, aesculin and leucine arylamidase; mostly positive for β-galactosidase.
Negative for β-glucuronidase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase and urease; mostly negative for agalactosidase.
Variable for pyrrolidonyl arylamidase.

Positive for enzymic hydrolysis of 4MU β-D-glucoside, 4MU α-D-glucoside, L-tryptophan, 4MUN-acetyl β-dglucosaminide, p-nitrophenyl β-D-cellobioside and p-nitrophenyl α-D-maltoside; mostly positive for hydrolysis of L-pyroglutamic acid AMC and onitrophenyl β-D-galactoside.
Negative for enzymic hydrolysis of L-valine, 4MU phosphate, 4MU β-D-glucuronide and L-isoleucine.
Variable for hydrolysis of L-phenylalanine AMC, p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucoside, proline and leucine p-nitroanilide and p-nitrophenyl phosphate.
The type strain, 330T (=CCM 4856T=LMG 19486T), was isolated from spring water.

It is positive in tests for inositol, starch, L-pyroglutamic acid AMC, o-nitrophenyl β-D-galactoside, proline and leucine p-nitroanilide and β-galactosidase; negative for L-sorbose, D-raffinose, glycogen, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, L-phenylalanine AMC, p-nitrophenyl β-D-glucoside, p-nitrophenyl phosphate and α-galactosidase.
All other characteristics are in agreement with the species description.
The G­+C content of strain 330T is 36.3 mol%.
